docs.title: emacs-r-devkit
docs.text: Professional Emacs environment for R package development on macOS

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text:
• ESS Integration

    Full Emacs Speaks Statistics support with R console, code evaluation, and REPL interaction.

  • Flycheck + Linters

    Real-time syntax checking with lintr and custom styler integration for code quality.

  • LSP Mode

    Language Server Protocol support with R languageserver for intelligent code navigation.

  • Smart Completion

    Company mode with context-aware autocompletion for R functions and objects.

  • Roxygen2 Automation

    Automatic documentation skeleton generation with parameter detection.

  • Auto-Formatting

    Styler integration for automatic code formatting on save with error guards.

  • S7 Support

    Built-in snippets and helpers for R's new S7 object-oriented programming system.

  • Usethis Integration

    Quick commands for creating R files, tests, and package documentation.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This document provides a detailed reference for the internal Emacs Lisp functions provided by emacs-r-devkit. These functions can be used interactively or called within your own Emacs configuration.

docs.title: 1. Overview
docs.text:
The emacs-r-devkit exposes a set of functions designed to automate R package development tasks. All functions are prefixed with emacs-r-devkit/ to avoid namespace collisions.

  • Prefix: emacs-r-devkit/
  • Primary Keymap: C-c r

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/insert-roxygen-skeleton
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r r
  • Description: Inserts a comprehensive Roxygen2 documentation skeleton for the R function at point.
  • Features:
    • Automatically parses function signatures to generate @param tags.
    • Extracts parameter names while ignoring default values.
    • Uses the currently selected region (if any) as the content for the @examples section.
    • Includes @title, @description, @return, and @export tags by default.

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/style-buffer-with-guard
docs.text:
• Hook: before-save-hook
  • Description: Formats the current buffer using the R styler package.
  • Safety Mechanism: It styles a temporary file first. If R code contains syntax errors and styler fails, the buffer remains untouched, preventing the insertion of error messages into your source code.

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/toggle-styler
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r S
  • Description: Toggles the automatic styling-on-save feature.
  • Related Variable: emacs-r-devkit/styler-enabled (can be set via .dir-locals.el).

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/usethis-use-r
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r u
  • Description: Prompts for a filename and executes usethis::use_r(). Automatically opens the newly created file in R/.

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/usethis-use-test
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r t
  • Description: Prompts for a test name and executes usethis::use_test(). Opens the test file in tests/testthat/.

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/usethis-use-package-doc
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r p
  • Description: Executes usethis::use_package_doc() to create or update the package-level documentation.

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/s7-insert-class
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r s c
  • Description: Inserts a template for a new S7 class definition (s7::new_class).

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/s7-insert-method
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r s m
  • Description: Inserts a template for an S7 method definition (s7::method).

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/s7-insert-generic
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r s g
  • Description: Inserts a template for a new S7 generic function (s7::new_generic).

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/export-gui-path
docs.text:
• Keybinding: C-c r P
  • Description: Runs an external script (export-gui-path.sh) to export the current shell PATH to the macOS launchctl environment. This is essential for GUI Emacs to locate R, quarto, and other CLI tools.

docs.text: • Description: Returns t if the system is macOS.

docs.title: emacs-r-devkit/is-gui
docs.text: • Description: Returns t if Emacs is running in a windowed (GUI) session.

docs.text:
You can use these functions in your own custom Elisp to build specialized workflows:

```elisp (defun my/quick-r-feature (name) "Create a new R file and add a roxygen skeleton immediately." (interactive "sFeature Name: ") (emacs-r-devkit/usethis-use-r name) (insert (format "%s <- function(x) {

}" name)) (forward-line -1) (emacs-r-devkit/insert-roxygen-skeleton)) ```text

docs.text: The ~/.spacemacs file has three main sections:

elisp dotspacemacs-configuration-layers '( auto-completion ess ; R support git lsp syntax-checking ;; Add more layers here )bash

elisp dotspacemacs-themes '(spacemacs-dark spacemacs-light) dotspacemacs-default-font '("Source Code Pro" :size 13)bash

docs.title: test_unclosed_code_blocks()
docs.text:
What it tests: Detection of malformed markdown with unclosed code fences

How it works:

  • Counts ``` markers in each markdown file
  • Fails if count is odd (unclosed block)

Example failure:

# Document
```python
def foo():
    return True
# Missing closing ```

docs.title: test_missing_images()
docs.text:
What it tests: Validation of image file references

How it works:

  • Extracts all ![alt](path) references
  • Checks if referenced files exist
  • Reports as warnings (non-blocking)

Example failure:

![Missing](./nonexistent.png)

docs.title: test_yaml_frontmatter()
docs.text:
What it tests: YAML syntax in document frontmatter

How it works:

  • Parses YAML between --- markers
  • Checks for required colons in key-value pairs
  • Validates indentation

Example failure:

---
title: Document
invalid yaml here
---

View detailed error:

Run single test:

# Emacs Lisp
emacs --batch -l tests/test-emacs-r-devkit.el \
  -f ert-run-tests-batch-and-exit

# R

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Always test edge cases when adding new features
  2. Use realistic fixtures based on actual user scenarios
  3. Document expected behavior in test comments
  4. Keep tests isolated - no dependencies between tests
  5. Mock external dependencies (user input, file system)

Full integration with R for interactive development.

  • Interactive R console (SPC SPC R or , s i)
  • Send code from buffer to R (, s l for line, , s r for region)

docs.title: Flycheck Integration
docs.text:
Real-time syntax and style checking with multiple checkers.

Checkers:

  1. lintr - R code linting

    • Syntax errors
    • Style violations
    • Code smells
    • Best practice violations

  2. r-styler - Code style validation

    • Tidyverse style guide compliance
    • Custom styler checker at ~/.emacs.d/bin/r-styler-check.R

In Action:

  • Errors shown with red squiggles
  • Warnings with orange squiggles
  • Info with blue squiggles
  • List all issues: SPC e l
  • Jump to next: SPC e n
  • Jump to previous: SPC e p

docs.title: LSP Mode
docs.text:
Language Server Protocol support for intelligent code navigation.

Features:

  • Go to definition (, g g)
  • Find references (, g r)
  • Go back (, g b)
  • Symbol search
  • Hover documentation
  • Code actions
  • Rename refactoring (, r s)

Requirements:

(defun obs-r-link-project (obsidian-path) "Link the current R project to a specific Obsidian folder." (interactive "sObsidian Folder Path (e.g., Research_Lab/MyProject): ") (shell-command (format "obs r-dev link \"%s\"" obsidian-path)) (message "Linked current project to %s" obsidian-path))

(defun obs-log-file (file description) "Log a specific file to the Obsidian Lab Notebook (06_Analysis)." (interactive "fFile to log: \nsDescription: ") (let ((cmd (format "obs r-dev log \"%s\" -m \"%s\"" (expand-file-name file) description))) (shell-command cmd) (message "Logged %s to Obsidian." (file-name-nondirectory file))))

(defun obs-fetch-theory (term) "Search the Knowledge Base for a theoretical concept and display it." (interactive "sSearch Concept: ") (let ((result (shell-command-to-string (format "obs r-dev context \"%s\"" term)))) (with-current-buffer (get-buffer-create "Obsidian Context") (erase-buffer) (insert result) (markdown-mode) (display-buffer (current-buffer)))))

docs.title: Performance Analysis & Optimization
docs.text: This document outlines the performance characteristics of emacs-r-devkit, identifies current bottlenecks, and provides optimization strategies for a smoother development experience.

docs.title: 1. Core Workflow Analysis
docs.text: The primary "hot path" in this environment is the Edit-Save-Check loop. Because emacs-r-devkit automates formatting and linting on save, the efficiency of these operations directly impacts perceived editor latency.

docs.title: The Styler Bottleneck
docs.text:
Currently, emacs-r-devkit/style-buffer-with-guard executes a fresh Rscript process on every save: 1. I/O Overhead: Writes buffer to disk. 2. Process Fork: Spawns a shell. 3. R Startup: Loads the R interpreter and the styler package (~300ms - 800ms). 4. Execution: Performs the actual styling.

Impact: High latency. Users may experience a "freeze" of up to 1 second every time they save a file.

docs.title: High Priority: Garbage Collection (GC) Stutter
docs.text:
• Problem: The default post-startup gc-cons-threshold is set to 20MB.
  • Symptom: Micro-stutters during heavy LSP usage or while scrolling through large files.
  • Fix: Increase threshold to 100MB to allow longer stretches of work between collections.

docs.title: Medium Priority: Sequential Dependency Checks
docs.text:
• Problem: check-dependencies.sh runs Rscript -e multiple times in a loop to check for individual packages.
  • Symptom: The script takes 10+ seconds to run.
  • Fix: Batch all package checks into a single R script call.

docs.title: A. Batch R Package Verification
docs.text:
Instead of individual calls, use a vectorized check in check-dependencies.sh:

```bash

docs.title: Optimized R check
docs.text: Rscript -e \ 'pkgs <- c("devtools", "usethis", "roxygen2", "testthat", "lintr", "styler") installed <- installed.packages()[,"Package"] missing <- setdiff(pkgs, installed) if (length(missing) > 0) { cat(paste("Missing:", missing, collapse="\n")) quit(status=1) }' ```bash

docs.title: B. Tune Emacs Garbage Collection
docs.text:
Update init.el to use more modern memory limits:

elisp (add-hook 'emacs-startup-hook (lambda () ;; Increase threshold to 100MB for better LSP performance (setq gc-cons-threshold (* 100 1024 1024))))bash

docs.title: C. Persistent Formatting (LSP)
docs.text: To eliminate the styler process overhead, transition from a shell-based Rscript call to LSP-driven formatting. - The languageserver package for R supports styling. - By using lsp-format-buffer, the already-running R process (the language server) handles the request, reducing latency to near-zero.

docs.title: 4. Resource Usage Summary
docs.text: Resource Usage Pattern Status CPU High during R startup (styler on save) 🟡 Needs Optimization Memory Baseline ~300MB; spikes during LSP indexing ✅ Acceptable Startup Time ~1-2s (deferred loading) ✅ Optimized I/O Frequent writes to ~/.emacs.d/auto-saves/ ✅ Optimized

docs.text:

docs.text:
Solutions to common issues with emacs-r-devkit Spacemacs environment on macOS.

Quick Diagnosis

Run the dependency checker first: 

./check-dependencies.sh
This identifies most common problems automatically.

docs.title: Configuration Not Found
docs.text:
Symptom: Spacemacs starts but emacs-r-devkit features don't work

Solution:

```bash

docs.title: Check if .spacemacs exists
docs.text: ls -la ~/.spacemacs

docs.title: If missing, copy from emacs-r-devkit
docs.text: cd ~/emacs-r-devkit cp dotspacemacs.el ~/.spacemacs

docs.title: Verify helper scripts
docs.text: ls -la ~/.emacs.d/bin/ ```bash

docs.title: Conflicting Configuration
docs.text:
Symptom: Emacs won't start, shows errors about packages

Solution:

```bash

docs.title: Backup existing config
docs.text: mv ~/.spacemacs ~/.spacemacs.backup

docs.title: Copy fresh config
docs.text: cd ~/emacs-r-devkit cp dotspacemacs.el ~/.spacemacs

docs.title: Restart Spacemacs
docs.text: open -a Emacs ```bash

docs.title: Slow First Launch
docs.text:
Symptom: First launch takes > 15 minutes

Expected: This is normal! Spacemacs layer installation takes 10-15 minutes.

Solutions:

  1. Be patient - watch for layer installation progress
  2. Check progress: SPC h d v then type *Messages*
  3. If truly stuck (>30 min):

```bash

docs.title: Kill Emacs
docs.text: killall Emacs emacs

docs.title: Delete package cache
docs.text: rm -rf ~/.emacs.d/elpa/

docs.title: Restart (will re-download)
docs.text: open -a Emacs ```bash

docs.title: Package Installation Errors
docs.text:
Symptom:

yaml Error: Package ... is unavailabletext

Solution:

text In Emacs: M-x package-refresh-contents RET M-x package-install RET use-package RETtext

Or clean install:

bash rm -rf ~/.emacs.d/elpa/ open -a Emacsbash

docs.title: Stuck in Insert Mode
docs.text:
Symptom: Can't execute commands, everything types text

Solution:

Press ESC or type fd quickly to return to Normal mode.

Prevention: Learn the modes:

  • Normal mode (<N>) - For navigation and commands
  • Insert mode (<I>) - For typing text
  • Visual mode (<V>) - For selecting text

docs.title: Leader Key Not Working
docs.text:
Symptom: SPC just types a space

Diagnosis:

You're in Insert mode!

Solution:

  1. Press ESC to return to Normal mode
  2. Then press SPC - should show which-key menu

docs.title: Modal Editing Confusion
docs.text:
Symptom: Commands don't work as expected

Solution:

Check your mode indicator in the status line:

  • <N> = Normal mode (for commands)
  • <I> = Insert mode (for typing)
  • <V> = Visual mode (for selecting)

Quick reference:

  • i = Enter Insert mode
  • ESC or fd = Return to Normal mode
  • v = Enter Visual mode

docs.text:

text SPC h L # List installed layerstext

Solution:

Edit ~/.spacemacs and verify layers:

elisp dotspacemacs-configuration-layers '( auto-completion ess lsp syntax-checking git )text

Then reload: SPC f e R

docs.text:

elisp ((ess-r-mode . ((emacs-r-devkit/styler-enabled . nil))))text

text , =bash

elisp (setq company-idle-delay 0) # Immediatebash

docs.title: M- Keys Don't Work
docs.text:
Symptom: SPC doesn't work, , doesn't work

Diagnosis:

You're in Insert mode! Press ESC first.

In Normal mode:

text SPC h d k SPCtext

Should say SPC runs spacemacs-cmds

Solutions:

Make sure you're in Normal mode (press ESC).

For traditional Emacs keybindings, you can still use Option (⌥) as Meta:

  • M-x = Option-x (or use SPC SPC)
  • M-. = Option-. (or use , g g)

docs.title: Major Mode Leader Not Working
docs.text:
Symptom: , does nothing in R files

Diagnosis:

  1. Make sure you're in Normal mode (press ESC)
  2. Make sure you're in an R file (.R extension)
  3. Check which-key:

text SPC h d v which-key-mode RETtext

Solutions:

Verify ESS mode is active:

text SPC h d v major-mode RETtext

Should return ess-r-mode.

docs.title: GUI Spacemacs Can't Find R
docs.text:
Symptom: SPC SPC R → "R not found" (but terminal finds R fine)

Diagnosis:

```bash

docs.title: Terminal
docs.text: which R echo $PATH

docs.title: Spacemacs
docs.text:
SPC h d v getenv RET (type PATH) SPC h d v executable-find RET (type R) ```text

Solutions:

Spacemacs uses exec-path-from-shell automatically.

If still having issues, reload configuration:

text SPC f e Rtext

Verify exec-path-from-shell:

text SPC h d v package-installed-p RET Type: exec-path-from-shelltext

Manual PATH fix (add to ~/.spacemacs user-config):

elisp (setenv "PATH" (concat (getenv "PATH") ":/usr/local/bin:/opt/homebrew/bin")) (setq exec-path (append exec-path '("/usr/local/bin" "/opt/homebrew/bin")))bash
